UML:TaggedValue.value: It should be possible to advance more than one workflows to the next step with a single call.
It should be possible to view and update variables of running instances

It should be possible to support workflow steps which call one or more (external system) services to perform an action. The following cases should be handled:
  • Errors in the called services should also be handled somehow (ex. with an error callback).
  • Multiple services are called some of which return with errors. It should be possible in this case to notify the rest.

It should be possible to specify for a human task the (external application) page to be displayed to the user in order to execute this task. The page definition should also support argument passing in order to support for example specifying a QBE form to be included in an iframe in the page.
It should be possible to view a list of pending tasks for a specific user along with a set of data kept either by the QBE or by the external system related to each of these tasks.

UML:ClassifierRole.name: REQ022 - Automatic spawning of workflow instance

UML:TaggedValue.value: It should be possible to spawn a workflow instance automatically, based on a scheduled job.
An API should be available for spawning a new workflow instance based on a specific workflow definition and (optionally) "jumping" to a specific step of the workflow
User should be able to download a workflow definition or upload a new definition for an existing or new workflow.
It should be possible to support taking decisions which are part of the workflow based on the result of executing a set of rules present in the QBE.

UML:ClassifierRole.name: REQ021 - Preconditions to begin a workflow instance

UML:TaggedValue.value: It should be possible to define a set of preconditions which should be met in order for a workflow instance to be started. This set of preconditions will be a set of rules defined in the QBE. The preconditions should be checked before spawning a workflow instance, while it should be also possible to inquire on the status of the preconditions, ie. if a workflow instance can be started.
Workflow definitions should be supported in BPMN2 and optionally in XMI

UML:ClassifierRole.name: REQ016 - Support of multiple output flows

UML:TaggedValue.value: It should be supported to have multiple output flows after a human task, based on a decision made by the user during the execution of the task (ex. the user selects one of 3 buttons).

When uploading a new workflow definition for an existing workflow a new version of the workflow should be created. Existing instances of the workflow should continue using the workflow definition with which they were created but new instances should use the new version of the workflow definition.
REQ016 - Support of multiple output flows
REQ022 - Automatic spawning of workflow instance
REQ022 - Automatic spawning of workflow instance
REQ021 - Preconditions to begin a workflow instance
